bug.author: XiaomoWu
bug.description:
Please make sure that this is a documentation issue. As per our GitHub Policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests and build/installation issues on GitHub. tag:doc_template System information
TensorFlow version: 1.13 Doc Link: tf.keras.losses.CategoricalCrossentropy
Describe the documentation issue In the example code <denchmark-code>loss = cce( [[1., 0., 0.], [0., 1., 0.], [0., 0., 1.]], [[.9, .05, .05], [.5, .89, .6], [.05, .01, .94]]) </denchmark-code>
I think the second array in the second line should be [.05, .89, .06] instead of [.5, .89, .6], as they're supposed to be summed to one. We welcome contributions by users. Will you be able to update submit a PR (use the doc style guide) to fix the doc Issue?

comments.comment: Thank you for noticing this and submitting the PR! Approving now. ðŸ™‚

Thank you so much. Fixed in nightly: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/losses/CategoricalCrossentropy?version=nightly#class_categoricalcrossentropy>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/losses/CategoricalCrossentropy?version=nightly#class_categoricalcrossentropy</denchmark-link>
